last_200_tokens: HP:0000752: Personality changes - HP:0000976: Eczematoid dermatitis - HP:0000988: Atypical scarring of skin - HP:0001251: Seizure - HP:0001717: Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome - HP:0001761: Abnormal foot morphology - HP:0002014: Vomiting - HP:0002487: Myotonia - HP:0002751: Delayed skeletal maturation - HP:0010522: Gait apraxia Candidate genes and their OMIM associations: - RRM2B (ENSG00000048392): Mitochondrial DNA depletion syndrome 8B (MNGIE type), Mitochondrial DNA depletion syndrome 8A (encephalomyopathic type with renal tubulopathy), Rod-cone dystrophy, sensorineural deafness, and Fanconi-type renal dysfunction, Progressive external ophthalmoplegia with mitochondrial DNA deletions Looking at the phenotype pattern, the patient has: - Neurological symptoms (seizures, abnormal nervous system, personality changes, gait apraxia) - Muscular symptoms (myotonia) - GI symptoms (vomiting) - Skeletal abnormalities - Skin issues - Cardiac abnormality (Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome) The key insight is that RRM2B is associated with mitochondrial DNA depletion syndrome, specifically MNGIE (Mitochondrial Neurogastrointestinal Encephalopathy) type. This syndrome affects multiple organ systems: - Neurological involvement (encephalopathy) - Gastrointestinal involvement (explaining vomiting) - Muscular involvement (progressive external ophthalmoplegia can cause muscle weakness) - Can cause systemic symptoms affecting multiple organs This matches the patient's complex phenotype pattern better than other genes which tend to have more specific, single-system associations. The causal gene is ENSG00000048392 (RRM2B).</think> <solution> {'causal_gene': ['ENSG00000048392']} </solution>
